name: normatively

in a way that relates to rules, or making people obey rules, especially rules of behaviour: The experiment looked at whether people would behave normatively in extremely high-stress contexts. They see ethical leadership as the demonstration of normatively appropriate conduct in all one's personal actions.
More examplesFewer examplesThe absence of dialect words from their speech doesn't necessarily mean that they are speaking normatively.The huge changes in the last 100 years mean that many things that are normatively acceptable today would have caused a scandal back then.
